paragraph.value: Overall the SVM with polynomial degree 1 kernel outperformed all other kernels with other kernels generally offering better precision at a higher cost to recall. Precision (Positive predictive) values ranged from 82.0 to 93.8 for SVM (polynomial degree 1) and from 83.3 to

paragraph.expression: numToStr (foldr (fun x acc -> if x > acc then x else acc) (head (map (fun x -> x.naive_bayes_p) tableData)) (map (fun x -> x.naive_bayes_p) tableData))

paragraph.value: for NB. Recall (sensitivity) values ranged from 58.3 to 96.2 for SVM (polynomial degree 1) and from 74.7 to 90.3 for NB. SVM tended to offer a reduced level of precision but better recall. In the case of one syndrome (Hemorrhagic) we noticed an unusually low level of recall for SVM but not for NB.
